helpPanelContents.installationParameters: During the installation process, the Linux installer requires additional files from the installation medium. These files must be provided through a network protocol by a server that contains an exact copy of the installation media contents.

Specify the URL to access installation files in the Installation address input field. Supported protocols are FTP, HTTP, and HTTPS. Use the "Username" and "Password" fields to specify access information if required. Passwords must not contain spaces.

Note: Passwords are in clear text in the resulting parameter file. The passwords are also stored in the browser's local storage as obfuscated strings. Use "Clear settings" menu item in the About this app menu under the Linux penguin icon to delete application data from the browser's local storage.
When the installation is started, the installer can be controlled either through a VNC-based GUI, or an SSH text-based interface.
Set the Start VNC installation toggle to yes and specify an optional password to enable the graphical installation.
Set the Start SSH installation toggle to enable text-based installation. Not all installer options may be available when using the text-based interface.
